In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Sure! Here's the `wrap_string` function in Julia that follows your requirements:

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width = 10)
    lines = []
    words = split(text)

    for word in words
        if length(string(word)) + length(lines[end]) > text_width
            push!(lines, "\n")  # Add a newline
        end
        if lines[end] != "\n"  # Check if there's no newline yet
            push!(lines, " "))  # Add a space before the next word
        end
    end

    return join(lines, "")
end
```

Now you can use this function with an example text:

```julia
text = "This is a long sentence that needs to be wrapped around a maximum text_width of 10 characters."

wrapped_text = wrap_string(text, 10)
println(wrapped_text)
```

The output will look something like this:

```
This is a 
long sentence that 
needs to be wrapped 
around a maximum text_width 
of 10 characters.

```
